A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
TLJ is a tragic disappointment.  No amount of glossy prepaid reviews can change this.  I don't know how all these so called "life long Star Wars fans" could possibly have enjoyed it.  There are a lot of things I could criticize (awful jokes\, Rey's ability to do everything without any training\, etc.) but I think the most unforgivable travesty in this\, is the treatment of Luke Skywalker and Mark Hamill.  

For reasons that probably only Kathleen Kennedy and Rian Johnson know\, they chose to turn Luke Skywalker into an irrelevant joke.  A bitter\, angry old useless man who thinks about murdering kids and no longer cares about his family or anyone else.  

This is not true to the character\, it's not believable\, it feels addenda driven.  It is a slap in the face to all the fans.  And judging by the end of TFA\, it's clearly not what JJ intended to happen\,  Not only did it make for terrible dialog and awkward scenes\, but it passed up the chance to preserve the specialness of the OT\, while simultaneously advancing the world of Star Wars for generations to come.  

Thanks Disney\, you've made me appreciate the prequels.  At least they had a purpose.
